title: 6.射手和农场主
paragraphs: 第二天是周末，汪淼反而起得很早，带上相机骑着自行车出去了。作为一名摄影爱好者，他最向往的题材是人迹罕至的荒野，但人到中年，已经没有精力进行这种奢侈的享受了，大多数时间只能在城市里拍风景了。他有意无意地选取城市中那些散发着蛮荒气息的角落，如公园中干涸的湖底、建筑工地上翻出的新土、钻出水泥缝隙的野草等。为了消除背景上城市的俗艳色彩，他只使用黑白胶片，没想到竟自成一派，渐渐小有名气，作品入选了两次大影展，还加入了摄影家协会。每次出去拍摄，他就这样骑着自行车在城市里随意乱转，捕捉着灵感和他需要的构图，有时一转就是一整天。
今天，汪淼的感觉有些异样。他的摄影以古典风格的沉稳凝重见长，但今天，他很难再找到创造这种构图所需要的稳定感，在他的感觉中，这座正在晨曦中苏醒的城市似乎建立在流沙上，它的稳定是虚幻的。在刚过去的那一夜，那两颗台球一直占据着他长长的梦境，它在黑色的空间中无规则地乱飞，在黑色的背景一卜。黑球看不见，它只有在偶尔遮挡白球时才显示一下自己的存在。
难道物质的本原真的是无规律吗？难道世界的稳定和秩序，只是宇宙某个角落短暂的动态平衡？只是混乱的湍流中一个短命的旋涡？
不知不觉中，他已骑到了新落成的CCTV大厦脚下。他停下车，坐到路边，仰望这A字形的巍峨建筑，试图找回稳定的感觉，顺着大厦在朝阳中闪烁的尖顶的指向，他向深不见底的蓝色苍穹望去，脑海中突然浮现出两个词：射手、农场主。奋斗者 侯沧海商路笔记
在“科学边界”的学者们进行讨论时，常用到一个缩写词：SF，它不是指科幻，而是上面那两个词的缩写。这源自两个假说，都涉及到宇宙规律的本质。
“射手”假说：有一名神枪手，在一个靶子上每隔十厘米打一个洞。设想这个靶子的平面上生活着一种二维智能生物，它们中的科学家在对自己的宇宙进行观察后，发现了一个伟大的定律：“宇宙每隔十厘米，必然会有一个洞。”它们把这个神枪手一时兴起的随意行为，看成了自己宇宙中的铁律。
“农场主假说”则有一层令人不安的恐怖色彩：一个农场里有一群火鸡，农场主每天中午十一点来给它们喂食。火鸡中的一名科学家观察这个现象，一直观察了近一年都没有例外，于是它也发现了自己宇宙中的伟大定律：“每天上午十一点，就有食物降临。”它在感恩节早晨向火鸡们公布了这个定律，但这天上午十一点食物没有降临，农场主进来把它们都捉去杀了。
汪淼感到脚下的路面像流沙般滑动，A字形大厦仿佛摇晃起来，他赶紧收回目光。
仅仅是为了摆脱不安，汪淼强迫自己拍完了一个胶卷，午饭前回到了家。妻子带着孩子出去玩，中午不回来了。往常，汪淼一定会迫不及待地把胶卷冲出来，但今天他一点兴致都没有。简单地吃过午饭后，他倒头便睡，由于昨天夜里没睡好，一觉睡醒后都快五点了。他这时才想起上午拍的胶卷，便钻到那间由壁橱改成的狭窄暗室里去冲洗。
胶片很快冲出来了，他开始查看哪张值得放大洗成照片，在第一张就发现了一件离奇的事。这张拍的是一个大商场外的一小片草地，他看到底片正中有一行白色的东西，细看是一排数字：l200：00：00。
第二张底片上也有数字：ll99：49：33。
整卷胶片，每张底片上都有小小的一排数字！
汪淼立刻想到是胶卷的问题。他使用的l988年产的莱卡M2型相机，全机械手动，没有任何自动化功能，更不可能往胶片上叠印日期一类的数字。仅凭其品质卓绝的镜头和机械机构，即使在数码时代，也是专业相机中的贵族。
重新查看每张底片，汪淼很快发现了这些数字的第一个诡异之处：它们自动适应背景。如果背景：是黑色，数字则为白色，白色背景上的数字就是黑色，似乎是为了形成最大的反差便于观察者看清。当汪淼再看第十六张底片时，心跳加快了，感到暗室中有一股寒气沿着脊背升上来：
这张拍的是以一面老墙为背景的一棵枯树，老墙斑驳一片，在照片上黑白相间。在这样的背景上，那行数字以正常的位置无论是黑是白都不可能显示清楚，但它竟竖了起来，且弯曲自身，沿着枯树深色的树身呈白色显示，看上去仿佛是附着在枯树上的一条细蛇！
汪淼开始研究那些数字的数学关系，起初他以为是某种编号，但每组数字的间隔并不相同，他很快明白这是以小时、分、秒为单位的计时。他拿出了拍摄笔记，上面详细记录了每张照片的拍摄时间，精确到分。他发现两张照片上计时的差值与它们实际拍摄的时间间隔是一致的。很明显，这卷胶片上反向记录了某个以现实的速度流逝的时间。汪淼马上明白了它是什么。
一个倒计时。
倒计时从1200小时开始，到现在还剩余1194小时。
现在？不，是拍完胶卷最后一张那一时刻。这个倒计时还在继续吗？

汪淼走出暗室，取出一只新的黑白胶卷装到莱卡相机上，在房间里飞快地随意拍摄起来。最后又到阳台上拍了几张室外的画面。胶卷拍完后，他把它从相机里取出来，一头钻进暗室冲洗。冲出来的胶片上，那数字幽灵般地在每一张底片上不断显示出来，第一张是1187：27：39，从上一卷最后一张拍摄到拍这卷的第一张，正好是间隔这么长时间。以后的每一张的计时间隔为三到四秒，1187：27：35、1187：27：31、1187：27：27、1187：27：24……是他快速拍摄的间隔。
倒计时仍在继续。
汪淼再次给相机装上新胶卷，飞快地乱拍起来，有几张他是故意扣上镜头盖拍的。
当他将拍完的胶卷取出时，妻子和孩子回来了。在去冲洗前，他给莱卡装上第三个胶卷，把相机递给妻子：“来，拍完这卷。”
“拍什么？”妻子惊诧地看着丈夫。以前，他是绝不允许其他人碰自己的相机，当然她和儿子对那玩意儿也没兴趣，在他们眼里，那是一个两万多元买来的乏味的老古董。
“什么都行，随便拍。”汪淼把相机塞到妻子手中，一头钻进了暗室。
“那，豆豆，我给你拍吧。”妻子把镜头对准了儿子。
汪淼的脑海中突然浮现出幽灵般的数字像一条张开的绞索横在孩子面容前的幻象，他不由微微战栗了一下。“不，别拍儿子，随便拍别的什么吧。”
快门“咔嚓”一声，妻子拍了第一张，然后叫道：“这怎么按不动了？”汪淼教妻子扳了一个手柄，“这样，每次都要倒卷。”然后钻进了暗室。
“真麻烦。”身为医生的妻子不能理解，在千万级像素的数码相机已经普及的今天，还有人用这种过时的昂贵玩意儿，而且拍的还是黑白胶卷。
胶卷冲出来后，对着昏暗的红灯，汪淼看到那幽灵倒计时仍在继续，在一张张随意拍出的混乱画面上，包括那几张扣着镜头盖拍的，清晰地显示出：1l87：19：06、1187：19：03、1187：l8：59、1187：18：56……
妻子敲了两下暗室的门，告诉他拍完了。汪淼出门抓过相机，取胶卷时他的手明显地在颤抖。不顾妻子异样的目光，他拿着胶卷又回到暗室，死死地关上门。他干得很忙乱，显影液、定影液洒了一地，胶卷很快冲出来了，他闭上双眼，默默祈祷：别出现，不管是什么，别在现在出现，别轮到我……
他用放大镜沿着湿漉漉的胶卷看去，倒计时消失了，底片上只有妻子拍出的室内画面，在低速光圈下，她那不专业的操作拍出的画面一片模糊，但汪淼觉得这是他看过的最赏心阅目的照片了。
汪淼走出暗室，长出一口气，发现汗水已浸湿了全身。妻子去厨房做饭了，儿子也到自己的房间去玩，他一个人坐在沙发上，开始了稍微冷静的思考。

首先，这组在不同的拍摄间隔精确地记录时间流逝，并显示出智能迹象的数字，不可能是预留在胶片上的，只能是某种力量使其感光，那会是什么呢？是相机的问题吗？是某种装置被有意无意地放置到了相机中吗？他将镜头卸下来，把相机拆开，用放大镜仔细地观察着相机内部，检查着每个一尘不染的光洁机件，没有发现任何异常。那么，联想到那几张扣上镜头盖后拍摄的画面，最可能的感光源是外界某种穿透力很强的射线，但这在技术上同样是不可能的：射线源在哪儿？如何瞄准？
至少以现有技术而言，这种力量是超自然的。
为了进一步确定幽灵倒计时已经消失，汪淼又在莱卡相机中装上了一个胶卷，开始一张张地随意拍起来。当这次的胶卷冲出来后，刚刚稍微平静了一会儿的他又被推到了疯狂的边缘：幽灵倒计时又出现了，从画面显示的时间看，它根本就没有停止过，只是在妻子拍的那卷上没有显示而已。
汪淼冲出暗室，冲出家门，猛敲邻居的门，开门的是退休的张教授。
“老张，你家有没有相机？哦，不要数码的，要用胶卷的！”
“你这大摄影家朝我借相机？那个两万多的坏了？我只有数码的……你不舒服？脸色这么难看。”
“借我用用。”老张很快拿来一架很普通的柯达数码相机。
“给，里面的几张删掉就行……”
“谢谢！”汪淼抓过相机和胶卷，匆匆返回屋里。其实家里还有三架胶卷相机和一架数码相机，但汪淼觉得从别处借更可靠些。他看着摊放在沙发上的两架相机和几只黑白胶卷，略一思考后，又给莱卡装上了胶卷，然后将数码相机递给正在端饭的妻子：
“快，拍几张，就像刚才一样！”
“这是干什么？看你的脸色……你到底怎么了？！”妻子惊恐地望着他。
“你别管，拍！”
妻子放下手中的碟子，走过来看着丈夫，眼中的惊恐又加上了忧虑。
汪淼把柯达相机塞到过来吃饭的六岁儿子手里，“豆豆，你帮爸爸拍。就按这个，对，这是一张；再按一下，对对，又是一张；就这样。一直拍，对着哪儿都行。
儿子很快掌握了，小家伙很感兴趣，拍得很快。汪淼转身从沙发上拿起自己的莱卡，也拍了起来，父子俩就这样“咔嚓、咔嚓”地疯狂拍着，丢下妻子在频频闪光中不知所措，眼泪涌了出来。
“汪淼，我知道你最近工作压力很大，你可别……”
汪淼把莱卡相机的胶卷拍完，又从孩子手中抢过数码相机。他想了一下，为了避开妻儿的干扰，走到卧室中，自己用数码相机也拍了几张。他拍的时候用的是目视取景器，没用液晶屏，因为怕看到结果，虽然迟早要看。
汪淼取出莱卡里的胶卷钻进暗室，紧紧地关上门工作起来。冲洗完成后，他细看底片，因手在颤抖，他只能用双手握着放大镜——底片上，幽灵倒计时在继续。
汪淼冲出暗室，开始检查数码相机上的照片，从液晶屏上看到，刚才拍的数码照片中，儿子拍的部分没有显示倒计时；而在自己拍的那部分，倒计时清晰地显示出来，并且与底片上的同步变化。
汪淼使用不同的相机拍摄，目的是排除问题出在相机或底片上的可能性，但他无意中让孩子拍摄，加上之前让妻子拍摄，得出了一个更加诡异的结果：用不同相机和不同胶卷拍摄，别人拍出的都正常，幽灵倒计时只会在他拍摄的照片上出现！
汪淼绝望地抓起那堆胶卷，像抓着一团纠缠在一起的蛇，又像一团难以挣脱的绞索。
他知道，仅凭自己的力量是无法解决这个问题的，那么去找谁呢？大学和研究所里的同事是不行的，他们与自己一样，都是技术型思维的人；直觉告诉他，这件事已超出了技术之外。他想到了丁仪，可现在这人自己也陷入精神危机之中。他最后想到了“科学边界”，那是一群思想深刻而且活跃的人。
于是，他拨通了申玉菲的电话。
“申博士，我这里有些事，必须到你那里去一趟。”汪淼急促地说。
“来吧。”申玉菲只说了这两个字就挂断了电话。
汪淼吃了一惊，申玉菲平时说话也十分精简，以至于“科学边界”的一些人戏称她为“女海明威”.但这次，她竟连是什么事都不问，汪淼不知该感到安慰还是更加不安。
他将那团胶卷塞进一个提包，并带上那架数码相机，在妻子焦虑的目光中冲出家门。本来可以开车去的，但即使在这灯火灿烂的城市，他在路上也想有人陪伴，于是叫了出租车。
申玉菲住在新城铁线附近的一个高档别墅区，这里的灯光稀疏了许多，别墅群环绕着几个能垂钓的小人工湖，晚上有一种乡村的感觉。申玉菲显然很富有，但汪淼一直搞不清她的财产来源，她以前的研究职位和现在公司中的职位都挣不到这么多钱。不过她的别墅中并没有豪华享受的痕迹，那里是“科学边界”的一个聚会场所，其中的陈设很像一个带会议室的小图书馆。
在客厅里，汪淼见到申玉菲的丈夫魏成。这个四十岁左右的男人，一副敦厚的知识分子模样，汪淼对他的了解仅限于其姓名，申玉菲介绍时也只说了这些。他似乎没有工作，成天待在家里，对“科学边界”的讨论不感兴趣，对家里频繁来往的学者们也习以为常。

但他并非无所事事，显然在家研究着什么东西，整天沉浸在思考中，见到任何人都是心不在焉地打个招呼，然后回到楼上的房间里，他一天的大部分时间都待在那里。一次，汪淼在楼上无意中从半开的房门向里瞥了一眼，看到一个令人惊奇的东西：一台HP小型机。他不会看错的，因为这台设备与他工作的超导研究中心那台一样，黑灰色机箱，是四年前出品的RX8620.把这台价值上百万的设备放在家里似乎很奇怪，魏成每天一个人守着它到底在干什么？
“玉菲在上面有点事，您稍等一会儿吧。”魏成说，然后走上楼。
汪淼本打算等的，但实在坐不住，也跟着走上楼去，看到魏成正要进入他那个放着小型机的房间。他看到汪淼跟来似乎并不反感，指指对面的一个房间说：“哦，就在那个房间里，你去找她吧。”

汪淼敲门，门没锁，开了一个缝，他看到申玉菲正坐在电脑前玩游戏，令汪淼惊奇的是她竟穿着一套“V装具”。这是目前在游戏玩家中很流行的玩意儿，由一个全视角显示头盔和一套感应服构成，感应服可以使玩家从肉体上感觉到游戏中的击打、刀刺和火烧，能产生出酷热和严寒，甚至还能逼真地模拟出身体暴露在风雪中的感觉。汪淼走到她后面，由于游戏是在头盔中以全视角方式显示的，在显示器上什么都看不到。这时，汪淼想起大史让他记网址和邮件地址的事，无意中扫了一眼显示器，那个游戏登录界面上的英文名很特别，他记住了。

申玉菲摘下显示头盔，又脱下了感应服，戴上她那副在瘦削的脸上显得很大的眼镜，面无表情地对汪淼点点头，一个字都没说，等着他说话。汪淼拿出那团胶卷，开始讲述发生在自己身上的诡异事件。申玉菲注意听着，对那些胶片，只是拿起来大概扫了几眼，并没有细看，这令汪淼很震惊，现在他进一步确定申玉菲对此事并非完全不知情，这几乎令他停止了讲述，只是申玉菲几次点头示意他继续，才将事情讲完了。这时申玉菲才说出了他们见面后的第一句话：
“你领导的纳米项目怎么样了？”
这不着边际的问题令汪淼十分吃惊。“纳米项目？它与这有什么关系？”他指指那堆胶卷。
申玉菲没有说话，只是静静地看着他，等他回答自己的问题。这就是她的谈话风格，从不多说一个字。
“把研究停下来。”申玉菲说。
“什么？”汪淼认为自己听错了，“你说什么？”
申玉菲沉默着，没重复自己的话。
“停下来？！那是国家重点项目！”
申玉菲仍不说话，只是看着他，目光平静。
“你总得说出原因吧！”
“停下来试试。”
“你到底知道些什么？告诉我！”
“我能告诉你的就这些了。”
“项目不能停，也不可能停！”
“停下来试试。”
关于幽灵倒计时的简短谈话就到此为止，之后，不管汪淼如何努力，申玉菲再也没有说出一个与此有关的字，只是重复那句话：“停下来试试。”
“我现在明白了，‘科学边界’并不是像你们宣称的那样是一个基础理论的学术交流组织，它与现实的关系比我想像的要复杂得多。”汪淼说。
“相反，你得出这个印象，是因为‘科学边界’涉及的东西比你想象的更基础。”
绝望的汪淼没有告辞起身就走，申玉菲默默地一直送他到庭院的大门处，并看着他坐进出租车。正在这时，另一辆汽车疾驰而来，在门前刹住了。一个男人下车，借着别墅中透出的灯光，汪淼一眼就认出了他。
这人是潘寒，是“科学边界”里最著名的人物之一。作为一名生物学家，他成功地预言了长期食用转基因农产品造成的后代遗传畸形，还预言了转基因作物可能造成的生态灾难。与那些空洞地危言耸听的学者不同，他的预言充满了具体的细节，且都一一精确兑现，其准确度达到令人震惊的程度，以至于有传言说他来自未来。
他使自己闻名于世的另一个创举，是创建了国内第一个实验社会。与西方那些旨在回归自然的乌托邦社团不同，他的“中华田园”不是处于荒野之地，而是置身于最大的城市中。社团没有一分钱财产，包括食物在内的所有生活用品，均来自城市垃圾。与人们最初的预想不同，“中华田园”不但生存下来，而且迅速壮大，其固定成员已达三千多人，不定期到其中体验生活的人更是不计其数。
以这两个成功为基础，潘寒的社会思想也日益具有影响力。他认为，科技革命是人类社会的一种病变，技术的爆炸性发展与癌细胞的飞速扩散相当，最终的结果都是耗尽有机体的养分，破坏器官，导致其寄宿体的死亡。他主张废除那些“粗暴的”技术，如化石能源和核电，保留“温和的”技术，如太阳能和小水电。将大城市逐步解散，人口均匀分布于自给自足的小村镇中，以“温和技术”为基础，建立“新农业社会”。
“他在吗？”潘寒指指别墅的二楼问。
申玉菲没有回答，沉默地挡在他面前。
“我要警告他，当然也要警告你，别逼我们！”潘寒冷冷地说。
申玉菲仍没回答他，只是对出租车里的汪淼说：“走吧，没事。”然后示意司机开车。车发动后，汪淼再也没有听到他们说什么，他回头远远地看到，灯光下申玉菲一直没让潘寒走进别墅。
回到家已是深夜，汪淼在小区的门口走下出租车，一辆黑色桑塔纳紧贴着他刹住，车窗摇下，一股烟喷了出来，是大史，粗壮的身躯将驾驶座挤得满满的。
“哇，汪教授，汪院士！这两天过得可好？”
“你在跟踪我？真无聊！”
“别误会，我要是直直开过去不就完了，讲个礼貌打个招呼你还当成驴肝肺了。”大史露出他的特色傻笑，一副无赖相，“咋的，那边看到什么有用的信息没，交流交流？”
“我说过，我和你们没关系了，今后请不要跟踪我！”
“得——”大史开动了车子，“好像我愿意挣这俩夜班外勤费似的，球赛都耽误了。”
汪淼走进家门，妻儿已经睡了，他听到妻子在床上不安地翻身，嘴里发出模糊不清的声音，丈夫今天怪异的举动，不知会给她带来怎样的噩梦。汪淼吃了两片利眠灵，躺到床上，过了很长时间才艰难地进入梦乡。
他的梦境很纷乱，但其中的一个东西却恒定地存在着：幽灵倒计时。其实，倒计时在梦中出现是汪淼早就预料到的事。梦境中，他疯狂地击打悬浮在半空的倒计时，撕它、咬它，但一切击打都无力地穿透了它，它就悬在梦境正中，坚定地流逝着。它使汪淼烦躁至极，终于从梦中醒来。
他睁开眼，看到了模糊的天花板，外面城市的灯光透过窗帘，在上面投出黯淡的光晕。但有一样东西从梦中跟随他到现实中：幽灵倒计时。倒计时仍在他睁开的眼睛前显现，数字很细，但很亮，发出一种烧灼的白光。
汪淼转转头，看到了卧室中模糊的一切，确认自己已经醒来，倒计时没有消失。他闭上双眼，倒计时仍显现在他那完全黑暗的视野中，像黑天鹅绒上发亮的水银。他再次睁眼，并揉揉眼睛，倒计时仍没有消失，不管他的视线如何移动，那一串数字稳稳地占据着视野的正中央。
一股莫名的恐惧使汪淼猛地坐起来，倒计时死死跟随着他。他跳下床，冲到窗前，扯开窗帘，推开窗。外面沉睡中的城市仍然灯光灿烂，倒计时就在这广阔的背景前显现着，像电影画面上的字幕。
一时间，汪淼感到自己窒息了，不由发出一声低沉的惊叫。面对被惊醒的妻子恐慌的探问，他努力使自己镇定下来，安慰妻子说没什么，又躺回床上，闭上眼睛，在幽灵倒计时的照耀下艰难地度过了剩下的夜晚。
清晨起床后，汪淼努力使自己在家人面前显得正常些，但妻子还是看出了异样，问他的眼睛怎么了？是不是看不清东西？
早饭后，汪淼向纳米中心请了假，开车去医院。一路上，幽灵倒计时无情地横在他眼中的现实世界前面，这东西会自动调节自己的亮度，在不同的背景上都清晰地显现出来。汪淼甚至盯着初升的太阳，试图使倒计时被强光暂时隐没一会儿，但没有用，那串魔鬼数字竟在日轮上显现出来，这时它不是增加亮度，而是变成黑色，更加恐怖。
同仁医院很难挂号，汪淼直接找了妻子的一个同学，一位著名的眼科专家。他没有说病情，而是先让医生检查自己的眼睛。仔细检查了汪淼的双眼后，医生告诉他没有发现什么病变，眼睛一切正常。
“我的眼睛总是看见一个东西，不管你看哪里，这东西都在。”汪淼说。同时，那串数字就横在医生脸前。
“飞蚊症。”医生说，同时抽出处方签开始写，“我们这年纪的常见眼病，晶状体混浊。不太好治，但没什么要紧的，开些碘药水和维D吧，也许能吸收掉，但希望不大。不过，这确实没什么要紧的，只要你习惯了忽略视野里的那些杂物，对视力没什么影响。”
“你说的飞蚊症，那些……东西看上去是什么样子？”
“不规则，因人而易，有时是小黑点儿，有时像蝌蚪。”
“如果看到的是一串数字呢？”
医生写处方的笔停了。“你看到一串数字？”
“是的，横在视野中心。”
医生推开纸和笔，关切地看着他，“一进来我就看出，你过度劳累。上次同学聚会，李瑶向我提起你，说你的工作压力很大。到我们这岁数，应该注意了，健康可透支不起了。”
“你是说，我这是精神因素所致？”
医生点点头，“要是一般的病人，我就建议他去精神科了，其实没必要，没什么要紧的，就是太累了。休息几天吧，去度几天假，和李瑶、孩子，叫什么来着，豆豆吧，一起去。放心，很快会恢复的。”
“我告诉你我看到的是什么，一个倒计时！一秒一秒，在精确地走！这会是精神因素？”
医生宽容地笑笑，“想知道精神因素能对视力影响到什么程度吗？上个月我们收治了一个女孩儿，十五六岁吧，她在教室里突然间什么都看不见了，完全失明。可经过所有检查，眼睛在生理上完全正常。后来精神科的专家对她进行了一个月的心理治疗，又是突然间，她的眼睛恢复到正常的视力。”
汪淼知道在这里是浪费时间，他起身要走，最后说：“好吧，不管我的眼睛，我只有一个问题想请教你：有什么外力，能通过远程作用使人看到什么吗？”

医生想了想说：“有，我前一阵儿参加神舟l9号的医疗组，曾有航天员报告说，他们在舱外工作时看到了并不存在的闪光。以前国际空间站上的航天员报告过类似情况，都是在太阳活动剧烈的时候，太空中的高能粒子打到视网膜上，人就看到闪耀。不过你说的看到数字，还是倒计时，绝无可能是这个原因。”汪淼恍惚地走出医院，倒计时就在他眼前，他似乎在跟着它走，跟着一个死死缠着他的鬼魂。他买了一副墨镜戴上，仅仅是为了不让别人看到自己梦游般迷离的眼神。
汪淼走进纳米中心的主体实验室，进门之前没忘记把墨镜摘下来，尽管这样，遇见他的同事都对他的精神状态露出担心的神色。
在实验大厅中央，汗淼看到反应黑箱仍在运行中。这台巨型设备的主体是汇集了大量管道的一个球体。代号叫“飞刃”的超强度纳米材料已经生产出来，但是用分子建筑术制造的，就是用分子探针将材料分子像砌砖那样一个个垒砌起来，这样的工艺要耗费大量的资源，那些产品可以说是世界上最贵重的珍宝了，根本无法进行量产。

实验室现在做的，就是试图通过一种催化反应来代替分子建筑法，使巨量的分子在反应中同时完成筑砌。试验就是在反应黑箱中进行的，这台设备可以在数量庞大的成分组合上进行反应试验，这样数量的组合如果用传统的人工操作可能上百年也做不完，但在反应黑箱中可以快速自动进行。同时，这是一种集现实反应与数字模拟一体化的设备，当合成进行到一定程度时，计算机会根据反应的阶段性结果建立起合成反应的数字模型，将剩下的反应进程用数字模拟代替，大大提高了实验效率。

实验主任见到汪淼后，急匆匆走过来，开始汇报反应黑箱刚出现的一系列故障。这是近来汪淼上班就遇到的事。现在，反应黑箱连续运行了一年多，许多传感器灵敏度下降，误差增大，急需停机维护。但身为项目首席科学家的汗淼坚持做完第三批合成组合再停机，工程师们只好在反应黑箱上加入越来越多的补偿修正装置，到现在这些装置本身也需要补偿修正，搞得整个项目组疲惫不堪。但主任小心翼翼地没提停机和暂停试验的事，怕汗淼又像上几次那样大发雷霆。他只是把困难都摆出来，意思也很明白。
汪淼抬头看看反应黑箱，觉得它像一个子宫，工程师们正围着它忙碌，艰难地维持着正常的运行。在这场景前面，叠现着幽灵倒计时。
“停下来试试。“汪淼脑海中突然响起申玉菲的话。
“全面更新外围传感系统需要多长时间？”他问。
“四五天吧，”实验主任突然看到了希望，赶紧加一句，“快些干，三天就行，汪总，我保证！”
我并没有屈服，设备确实需要维修，因而试验必须暂停，与别的无关。汪淼在心里对自己说，然后转向主任，透过倒计时的数字看着他，“把试验停下来吧，停机维修，就照你说的时间表。”
“好的汪总，我会很快给你一份更新方案，下午就能停机了！”主任兴奋地说。
“现在就停吧。”
主任像不认识似的看着汪淼，但旋即恢复了兴奋状态，好像生怕失掉这个机会似的。他拿起电话下了停机命令，项目组里那些疲惫的研究员和工程师一下子都兴奋起来，开始按程序扳动上百个复杂的开关，众多的监控屏一个接一个地黑了下来，最后，主监控屏上显示了停机状态。
几乎与此同时，汪淼眼前的倒计时停止了走动，数字固定为1l74：10：07.几秒钟后，数字闪动了几下，消失了。
当没有幽灵倒计时覆盖的现实重现眼前时，汪淼长出了一口气，像刚从水底挣扎出来一样。他无力地坐下，很快意识到旁边还有人在看着他。
他对实验主任说：“系统更新是设备部的事，你们实验组的人好好休息几天吧，这一阵大家都辛苦了。“
“汪总，你也太累了，这里有张总工程师盯着，你也回家好好休息一下吧。”
“是啊，太累了。”汪淼无力地说，待他离开后，拿起电话，拨了申玉菲的号码，只响了一声铃她就接了。
“你们背后是什么？”汪淼问，尽量使自己的声音冷静一些，但没有做到。
沉默。
“倒计时的尽头是什么？”
沉默。
“你在听吗？”
“高强度纳米材料怎么了？这不是高能加速器，只是一项应用研究，值得这样关注么？”
“什么值得关注，不应由我们来判断。”
“够了！”汪淼大吼一声，心中的恐惧和绝望突然化为疯狂的怒气，“你们以为这点小魔术就能骗得了我？就能阻止技术进步！？我承认一时无法做出技术上的解释，但那是因为我还没有绕到那个可耻魔术师的背后！”
“你的意思，是想在更大的尺度上看到倒计时？”

申玉菲的话让汪淼愣了一下，他对这个问题没有准备，于是强迫自己冷静下来，以免落人圈套。“收起你那套把戏吧。大尺度又怎么样，你们同样可以玩魔术！可以向天空投映全息图像，就像上一次战争中北约做的那样，强力激光甚至可以将图像映满整个月球表面！射手和农场主应该能够玩弄人类力不能及的更大尺度，比如，倒计时能够显示到太阳表面吗？”话刚说完，汪淼吃惊地张大了嘴，他竟在下意识中说出了那两个这时应十分忌讳的名词，还好，没有说出更忌讳的那个。他想争取更多的主动性，于是接着说，“考虑到某种我还没想到的可能性，即使在太阳的尺度上，你们那个可耻魔术师仍有可能耍魔术，那种力量要真正令人信服，显示的尺度还需更大些。”
“问题是你能承受得了吗？我们是朋友，我想帮你，别走杨冬的路。”、
听到这个名字，汪淼不由打了个寒战，但随之而来的愤怒又使他不顾一切了：“能接受这个挑战吗？”
“你想怎么样？”汪淼的声音变得无力了。
“你旁边有上网的电脑吗？好，进这个网址：https://modernout.com/pages/morse-code-chart，打开了吗？把网页打印出来，随身带着。”
汪淼看到网页上显示的只是一张莫尔斯电码对照表。
“我不明白，这是……”
“在以后的两天内，设法找到一个能够观测宇宙背景辐射的地方。具体的请看我随后发给你的电子邮件。”
“这是……干什么呢？”
“我知道纳米研究项目已经停了，你打算重新启动它吗？”
“当然，三天以后。”
“那倒计时将继续。”
“我将在什么尺度上看到它？”
沉默良久，这个为某种超出人类理解力的力量代言的女人，冷酷地封死了汪淼的一切出路。
“三天后，也就是十四日，在凌晨一点钟至五点钟，整个宇宙将为你闪烁。”

translated_paragraphs: The second day was the weekend, and Wang Xiaomei got up early and went out with a camera on a bicycle. As a photography enthusiast, he most admired the subject of wilderness with few people, but at middle age, he no longer had the energy for such luxurious enjoyment, and most of the time he could only shoot landscapes in the city. He intentionally or unintentionally selected corners in the city that exuded a wild and荒芜 atmosphere, such as the dry lakebed in the park, the new earth exposed on construction sites, and the wild grass that sprang out of the cracks in the cement. In order to eliminate the俗艳 colors in the background, he only used black and white film, and he did not expect to form a unique style. His works gradually gained some fame and were selected for two large photography exhibitions. He also joined the Photography Association. Whenever he went out to shoot, he would ride his bicycle around the city randomly, capturing inspiration and the composition he needed, sometimes wandering for a whole day.

Today, Wang淼 feels a little different. His photography is known for its classical style and seriousness, but today he finds it difficult to find the stability needed to create such a composition. In his feeling, the city that is waking up in the morning light seems to be built on sand. Its stability is illusory. In the dream that just passed, those two balls have occupied a long dream of his. They are randomly flying in the black space, and only occasionally do they show their existence when they block the white ball. The black ball is invisible, and it only shows its existence when it occasionally blocks the white ball.
Is the essence of matter really without规律? Is the stability and order of the world just a temporary dynamic balance in a corner of the universe? Just a short-lived vortex in the chaotic turbulence?

He had ridden to the foot of the newly completed CCTV building不知不觉. He stopped his car and sat by the side of the road, looking up at the towering A-shaped building and trying to regain a sense of stability. Following the shining peak of the大厦 that pointed towards the endless blue sky in the朝阳, he looked up at the vast blue sky and suddenly two words came into his mind: archer, farmer. Striver侯沧海商路笔记

When scholars at the "Frontiers of Science" discuss, they often use an abbreviation: SF, which is not a reference to science fiction, but an abbreviation of the two words above. This originated from two hypotheses, both of which involve the essence of the laws of the universe.

The "Hunter" Hypothesis: There is a marksman who shoots a hole every ten centimeters on a target. Imagine that there is a two-dimensional intelligent species living on the surface of this target. After observing their own universe, the scientists among them discovered a great law: "The universe must have a hole every ten centimeters." They regarded the arbitrary behavior of the marksman as a law of their own universe.

The "Farmer's Paradox" has an unsettling恐怖 hue: In a farm, there is a group of turkeys, and the farmer comes to feed them every noon at 11 o'clock. A scientist among the turkeys observes this phenomenon and has been doing so for nearly a year without exception. Thus, it discovers its own great law of the universe: "At 11 o'clock every morning, food comes." On Thanksgiving morning, it announces this law to the turkeys. But this morning at 11 o'clock, no food came, and the farmer came in and caught them all to kill them.
汪淼 felt the ground beneath his feet like quicksand, and the A-shaped building seemed to be swaying. He quickly looked away.

In order to get rid of anxiety, Wang Xiaomao forced himself to finish a roll of film and returned home before lunch. His wife took the child out to play and wouldn't be back for lunch. As usual, Wang Xiaomao would be eager to develop the roll of film as soon as he got home, but today he had no interest in it at all. After a simple lunch, he fell asleep immediately. Because he hadn't slept well the night before, he woke up almost five o'clock. At this point, he remembered that he had filmed in the morning and went to the small and dark room where the cupboard had been converted to develop it.

The film quickly developed, and he began to examine which frame was worth printing into a photograph. In the first frame, he found something strange. This frame was of a small patch of grass outside a large shopping mall. He noticed a row of white words in the center of the negative. Upon closer inspection, he realized it was a series of numbers: 1200:00:00.
The second negative film also has numbers: ll99:49:33.
The whole roll of film, and each frame of the film has a small row of numbers on it!

Third card: 1199:40:18 Fourth card: 1199:32:07 Fifth card: 1199:28:51 Sixth card: 1199:15:41 Seventh card: 1199:07:38 Eighth card: 1198:53:09 ... Thirty-fourth card: 1194:50:49 Thirty-sixth card, and the last card: 1194:16:37.

Wang Ming immediately thought it was a problem with the roll of film. He was using a Leica M2 camera produced in 1988, which was fully mechanical and manual, and had no automated functions. It was also impossible to print dates or other digital numbers on the film.凭借其卓越品质的镜头和机械机构，即使在数码时代，也是专业相机中的贵族。

Re-examine each negative, and Wang淼 soon discovered the first strange thing about these numbers: they automatically adapt to the background. If the background is black, the numbers are white, and the numbers on a white background are black, as if to create the greatest contrast for the observer to see clearly. When Wang淼 looked at the sixteenth negative again, his heart rate increased, and he felt a chill rising up his spine in the dark room:

A tree stands against a backdrop of an old wall, weathered and spotted in the photograph. In such a background, the digits appear upright and bent, following the dark trunk of the withered tree and displayed in white, as if a slender snake were attached to the tree!

Wang Ming started to study the mathematical relationships of those digits. At first, he thought they were some kind of code, but the intervals between each group of digits were not the same. He quickly realized that this was a timing system in hours, minutes, and seconds. He took out his shooting notes, which recorded the shooting time of each photo in detail, to the nearest minute. He found that the difference in timing between two photos was consistent with the actual time interval between their shooting. It was obvious that this roll of film recorded the passage of time at a speed that was the reverse of reality. Wang Ming immediately understood what it was.
A countdown.
Countdown starts at 1200 hours and there are still 1194 hours left.
Now? No, it's the moment when the last frame of the roll of film is processed. Is the countdown still ongoing?

Wang Xiaoming stepped out of the dark room, took out a new roll of black and white film and loaded it into his Leica camera. He quickly shot around the room, making random photographs. Then he went out to the阳台 and shot a few more scenes of the outside world. After the roll of film was finished, he took it out of the camera and rushed into the dark room to develop it. When the developed film was printed out, the numbers of the digital ghost appeared on each negative, one by one. The first one was 1187:27:39, and the time interval between the last frame of the previous roll and the first frame of this roll was exactly this long. The time interval between each subsequent frame was three to four seconds, 1187:27:35, 1187:27:31, 1187:27:27, 1187:27:24... it was the interval between his rapid shots.
Countdown is still ongoing.
Wang淼再次安装上新胶卷，快速地乱拍起来，其中有几张他是故意扣上镜头盖拍的。
When he取出拍完的 roll of film, his wife and child returned. Before sending the film to be developed, he put on the third roll of film in Leica and handed the camera to his wife: "Here, shoot this roll."

"What are you taking a picture of?" the wife looked at her husband in surprise. In the past, he never allowed anyone else to touch his camera, and of course, she and her son had no interest in it. In their eyes, it was an old-fashioned and boring thing that cost more than 20,000 yuan.
"Anything is fine, just shoot." Wang Xiaomiao stuffed the camera into his wife's hand and disappeared into the dark room.
"Okay, Doudou, I'll take your picture." The wife aimed the camera at her son.

Suddenly, a ghostly digital image of a noose appeared in Wang Xiaoming's mind, stretching across the child's face like a bared rope. He couldn't help but shiver slightly. "No, don't take pictures of your son. Take pictures of anything else."

The camera shutter "clicks" and the wife takes the first shot. Then she calls out, "How do I make it move again?" Wang淼 teaches the wife to turn a handle, "Like this, you have to rewind every time." Then he disappears into the dark room.

"It's really a hassle." The wife of a doctor cannot understand why, in today's age when high-resolution digital cameras with million-level pixel counts are popular, there are still people using this outdated and expensive equipment, and they are even shooting black and white film.

After the roll was developed, against the dim red light, Wang淼 saw the countdown of the ghost still continuing. On the chaotic frames randomly taken, including the ones with the lens cap on, clearly showing: 1187:19:06, 1187:19:03, 1187:18:59, 1187:18:56...

Wife knocked twice on the door of the darkroom and told him to finish. Wang Xiaomei went out and grabbed the camera, took out the roll of film, and his hand was obviously shaking. He ignored his wife's strange gaze and took the roll of film back to the darkroom, shutting the door tightly. He was very busy, and the developer and fixer were spilled all over the floor. The film quickly developed, and he closed his eyes and prayed silently: Don't appear, no matter what, don't appear now, don't be my turn...

He peered through the magnifying glass at the damp roll of film, and the countdown disappeared, leaving only his wife's interior scenes on the底片. Under the slow shutter speed, her unprofessional operation resulted in a blurry picture, but Wang Xiaoming thought it was the most beautiful photo he had ever seen.

Wang Xiaoming stepped out of the dark room, took a deep breath, and found that his entire body was drenched in sweat. His wife was cooking in the kitchen, and his son had gone to his own room to play. He sat alone on the sofa and began to think slightly calmly.

Firstly, this set of digital numbers accurately recording the passage of time and displaying signs of intelligence cannot be pre-recorded on film, but must be produced by some kind of force that makes the film sensitive. What could that force be? Is it a problem with the camera? Was some device accidentally or intentionally placed in the camera? He removed the lens and took the camera apart, examining each spotless, polished mechanism with a magnifying glass. He found no anomalies. Then, considering the pictures taken after the lens cap was attached, the most likely source of the sensitive light was some kind of penetrating ray with a strong penetrating power. However, this is also technically impossible: where is the source of the ray? How to aim it?
From a technical perspective, at least, this power is supernatural.

In order to further determine that the ghost countdown has disappeared, Wang淼 put another roll of film into his Leica camera and started taking random shots. When the roll of film was developed, he was pushed to the brink of madness again: the ghost countdown appeared again, and according to the time displayed on the screen, it had never stopped, but it had not been displayed on the roll of film that his wife had taken.
Wang淼 rushes out of the dark room and out of the front door, pounding on his neighbor's door. When it opens, it is an retired professor Zhang.
"Old Zhang, do you have a camera at home? Oh, not a digital one, but a roll film one!"
"You, this big photographer borrowed my camera from me? That two thousand yuan one is broken? I only have a digital one... Are you not comfortable? Your face looks so unpleasant."
"Can I borrow it for a while?" Mr. Zhang quickly brought out a very ordinary Kodak digital camera.
"Give, just delete a few inside……"

"Thank you!" Wang Xiaomiao grabbed the camera and film, and rushed back into the house. In fact, there were three rolls of film cameras and a digital camera at home, but Wang Xiaomiao thought it was more reliable to borrow them from elsewhere. He looked at the two cameras on the sofa and a few rolls of black and white film, and after a moment's thought, he put a roll of film into the Leica again, and then handed the digital camera to his wife who was serving dinner:
"Quick, take a few shots, just like just now!"
"What are you doing? Looking at your face... What's wrong with you?" His wife stared at him in fear.
"You don't need to care, shoot!"
Wife puts down the plate in her hand and walks over to look at her husband, fear and worry in her eyes.

Wang Xiaoming passed the Kodak camera to his six-year-old son who came to have dinner, "Doudou, help Dad take pictures. Just press this, okay, this is one; press it again, okay, it's another one; like this. Keep taking pictures, wherever you look."

The son quickly mastered it, the little guy was very interested, and he shot quickly. Wang Mei turned around and picked up her Leica from the sofa and started shooting as well. The father and son were crazy about shooting "click, click" and left the wife in a series of flashes, not knowing what to do, tears flowed out.
"Wang Xiaomao, I know you've been under a lot of work pressure lately. Don't..."

Wang Xiaoming finished the roll of film on his Leica camera and then took over the digital camera from the child. He thought for a moment and, in order to avoid the interference of his wife and children, walked into the bedroom and used the digital camera to take a few more pictures. Wang Ming took out the roll of film from the Leica and went into the darkroom, closing the door tightly and working away. Wang Mei used different cameras to shoot, in order to exclude the possibility that the problem was with the camera or film. Wang Mei was frantically grabbing at the pile of film, like grabbing a bunch of intertwined snakes, or like a tangled rope that was difficult to escape.

Wang Xiaomei was surprised, and Shen Yufei usually spoke very concisely, to the point that some people at "The Edge of Science" joked that she was "a female Hemingway." But this time, she didn't even ask what had happened. Wang Xiaomei didn't know whether to feel relieved or more anxious.

Wang Xiaoming knocked on the door, but it was unlocked. He saw Shen Yufei sitting in front of the computer playing games. What surprised Wang Xiaoming was that she was wearing a "V outfit." How is the project headed by your leader going?

On the contrary, you form this impression because the things involved in "the boundary of science" are more fundamental than you imagine.

Based on these two successes, Pan Huan's social ideas are increasingly influential. A sudden sense of fear made Wang淼 jump up suddenly and the countdown was always following him. He jumped off the bed, rushed to the window, pulled open the curtain and pushed open the window. The city that was still asleep outside was still brightly lit, and the countdown was displayed in the vast background like subtitles on a movie screen.

At that moment, Wang Xiaomao felt like he couldn't breathe and let out a low-pitched scream involuntarily. Then he lay back in bed, closed his eyes, and struggled to pass the rest of the night under the glow of the ghost countdown.
After getting up in the morning, Wang Mei tried to act normally in front of his family, but his wife still noticed something was off and asked if he had hurt his eyes and couldn't see clearly.

After breakfast, Wang淼 went to the Nano Center to take a leave and drove to the hospital. Wang Xiaomo even stared at the rising sun, trying to make the countdown temporarily disappear with strong light, but it was no use. The devilish digits appeared on the sun, and at this time it was not increasing brightness, but becoming black and more terrifying.

It's difficult to get a reservation at Renmin Hospital, so Wang Xiaomao directly asked his wife's classmate, a famous ophthalmologist. "飘渺症," the doctor said, and began writing a prescription, "a common eye disease for our age, cloudy lens. "Yes, it's across the center of the field of view."

"You mean that this is caused by mental factors?"

The doctor nodded and said, "If it was a normal patient, I would advise him to go to the department of psychiatry. In fact, it's not necessary. It's not a big deal. He's just too tired. Take a few days off and go on vacation. And Li瑶, the child, what's his name, Ernie, right? Go together. Don't worry, he'll recover soon."
"What I saw was a countdown! One second at a time, moving precisely! Will this be a factor of the mind?"

The doctor smiled gently and said, "Do you want to know how much the psychological factors can affect vision? Last month, we received a girl who was around 15 or 16 years old. Suddenly, she couldn't see anything in the classroom and was completely blind. But after all kinds of inspections, her eyes were completely normal from a physiological perspective. Then the experts in the department of psychology treated her with psychological therapy for a month, and suddenly her vision returned to normal."

Wang Ming knows it's a waste of time here, so he gets up to leave and says, "Well, regardless of my eyes, I have only one question for you: is there any external force that can remotely cause people to see something?"

The doctor thought for a moment and said, "Yes, I participated in the medical team for Shenzhou 19 not long ago, and a space astronaut reported that they saw flashes that did not exist when they were working outside the cabin. Space astronauts on the International Space Station have reported similar situations before, and it was always when the activity of the sun was intense, high-energy particles in space hit the retina, and people saw flashes. However, the countdown you mentioned is impossible to be the cause." Wang淼 walked out of the hospital in a daze, and the countdown was right in front of him. It seemed as if he was following it, following a ghost that was haunting him. He bought a pair of sunglasses and put them on to avoid letting others see his dreamy and confused eyes.

Wang Xiaoming walked into the main laboratory of the Nano Center, and before entering, he didn't forget to take off his sunglasses, even though this was the case. However, when he met his colleagues, they all showed worried expressions about his mental state.

In the center of the experimental hall, Han淼 saw the reaction black box still running. The main body of this giant device was a sphere made up of a large number of pipes. The experiment being conducted in the laboratory now is to try to replace molecular assembly with a catalytic reaction, so that a large number of molecules can complete construction in the reaction at the same time. The experiment is conducted in a reaction black box, which can conduct reaction trials on a large number of composition combinations. If such a combination were done manually using traditional methods, it would take hundreds of years, but it can be completed quickly and automatically in the reaction black box. At the same time, this is a device that integrates real-time reaction with digital simulation. When the synthesis reaches a certain point, the computer builds a digital model of the synthetic reaction based on the阶段性 results of the reaction, and replaces the remaining reaction process with digital simulation, greatly improving the experimental efficiency.

The lab director rushed over to Wang Xiaoming and began to report a series of malfunctions that had occurred in the reaction black box since it was put into operation. This was something that Wang Xiaoming had encountered as soon as he started work. Now, the reaction black box has been running continuously for more than a year, and many sensors have become less sensitive, with larger errors. It is urgently needed to stop the machine for maintenance. However, as the project's chief scientist, Han Xiaoming insisted on completing the third batch of synthetic combinations before stopping the machine. As a result, engineers had to add more and more compensation and correction devices to the reaction black box, and these devices themselves also needed compensation and correction. This has made the entire project group exhausted. However, the director was careful not to mention stopping the machine or suspending the experiment, afraid that Han Xiaoming would explode again, as he had done several times before. He simply put all the difficulties on the table and made it clear.

Wang淼 looked up at the reaction black box and felt like it was like a womb. The engineers were bustling around it, struggling to maintain normal operation. In front of this scene, there were apparitions of countdown.
"Stop and try it." Wang Xiaomiao's mind suddenly echoed Sheng Yufei's words.
"How long will it take to fully update the outer sensing system?" he asked.
"It will take about five or six days," the experiment director suddenly saw hope and quickly added, "work faster, three days will do, Mr. Wang, I promise!"

I did not yield, the equipment did indeed need maintenance, so the experiment had to be suspended, and nothing else. Wang Xiaomiao said to himself in his heart, and then turned to the director, looking at him through the countdown numbers, "Stop the experiment, stop the machine for maintenance, and follow your time schedule."
"Good Mr. Wang, I will give you an updated plan soon, and the machine will be shut down this afternoon!" The director said excitedly.
"Stop now."

The director stared at Wang Xiaomao as if he didn't know him, but quickly regained his excited state, as if he was afraid to miss this opportunity. He picked up the phone and gave the stop-order command. The exhausted researchers and engineers in the project group immediately became excited and began turning over a hundred complex switches according to the program. One after another, the numerous monitoring screens went dark, and finally, the main monitoring screen displayed the stop status.
At the same time, the countdown on Wang淼's screen stopped moving and the number remained at 1174:10:07. A few seconds later, the number flickered and disappeared.

When the reality without the ghost countdown was projected before his eyes, Wang淼 took a deep breath, like he had just come up from the bottom of the water. He weakly sat down and soon realized that there was someone watching him beside him.

He told the director of the experiment, "System updates are the responsibility of the equipment department. You guys in the experiment group can take a few days off and rest. Everyone has been working hard lately."
"汪总, you are too tired. There is Mr. Zhang, the chief engineer, watching over everything. You should go home and have a good rest."
"Yeah, I'm so tired," Wang淼无力地说。当他离开后，他拿起电话，拨了Shen Yufei的号码。只响了一声铃，她就接了。
"What are you behind?" Wang Xiaomao asked, trying to keep his voice calm, but failing.
Silence.
"What is the end of the countdown?"
Silence.
"Are you listening?"
"There."
"What's wrong with high-strength nano materials? This is not a high-energy accelerator, just an application study. Is it worth paying attention to?"
"What should be focused on, should not be judged by us."

"Enough!" Wang Xiaomao shouted loudly, and suddenly the fear and despair in his heart turned into a疯狂 rage. "Do you think this little magic trick can fool me? Can it stop technological progress? I admit that I cannot explain the technical aspects at the moment, but that's because I haven't绕到那个可耻的魔术师的背后!"
"What do you mean by wanting to see the countdown on a larger scale?"

Shen玉菲's words made Wang淼 stunned for a moment. He was not prepared for this question, so he forced himself to calm down to avoid falling into a trap. "Put away your magic tricks. What's the big deal about the large scale? You can still play magic tricks! You can project holographic images into the sky, just like what NATO did in the last war. Even powerful lasers can project images across the entire surface of the moon! Archers and farmers should be able to play with larger scales that humans cannot achieve, such as, can a countdown display on the surface of the sun?" As he spoke, Wang淼 was astonished to open his mouth wide. He had said out of habit the two names that were now extremely taboo. Fortunately, he did not say the most taboo one. He wanted to gain more initiative, so he continued to say, "Considering some possibility that I have not yet thought of, even on the scale of the sun, your shameless magician may still be able to perform magic tricks. In order to truly convince people, the scale of display needs to be larger."
"Can you take it? We're friends, and I want to help you. Don't follow Yang Dong's path."
When he heard the name, Wang Xiaomu couldn't help but shiver, but the anger that followed made him disregard everything: "Are you willing to accept this challenge?"
"Yes."
"What do you want?" Wang淼的声音变得无力了。
"Is there a computer with internet access next to you? Great, go to this website: <https://modernout.com/pages/morse-code-chart>, did you open it? Print out the webpage and bring it with you."
Wang Xiaoming saw on the webpage only a Morse code table.
"I don't understand, what is this..."
"Find a place to observe cosmic background radiation within the next two days. Please refer to the email I will send you later for details."
"What is this...for?"

"Of course, three days later."
"The countdown will continue."
"What scale will I see it on?"
After a long silence, the woman who represented an power beyond human comprehension calmly shut off all of Wang Xiaomao's paths.
"Three days later, on the 14th, from one o'clock in the morning to five o'clock in the morning, the entire universe will shine for you."

As a photography enthusiast, his most desirable subject is wilderness that few people venture into, but as he entered middle age, he no longer had the energy to enjoy such luxury, and could only shoot landscapes in cities most of the time. He chose corners in the city with a wild atmosphere intentionally or unintentionally, such as dry lakes in parks, new soil exposed by construction sites, weeds poking out from cracks in cement. In his feelings, the city that is waking up in the morning light seems to be built on sand, and its stability is illusory. When scholars from the "science frontier" have discussions, they often use an abbreviation: SF. It is not for science fiction, but rather the two words abbreviated together. This comes from two hypotheses that deal with the essence of laws of the universe.

The "tracer bullet" hypothesis: There is one marksman who hits a target every ten centimeters. Assume that there is a two-dimensional intelligent being living on the surface of this target, and its scientists observe their own universe and find a great law: "In every ten centimeters of the universe, there must be a hole." They see the arbitrary behavior of the marksman as a law of their own universe.

The "farmer's axiom" has an unsettling horror color: in a farm, there is a group of turkeys. The farmer comes to feed them at noon every day. One of the scientists among them observes this phenomenon and has been observing it almost without exception for close to a year. Therefore, he also discovered his great law in the universe: "at ten o'clock every morning, food will come." On Thanksgiving morning, he announced this law to the turkeys, but that morning, at ten o'clock, no food came, and the farmer came in and caught all of them and killed them.
Wang Xiaomiao felt the road beneath his feet like flowing sand, and the A-shaped skyscraper seemed to sway, so he quickly withdrew his gaze.

In order to relieve his anxiety, Wang Mo forced himself to take a roll of film and returned home before lunchtime. His wife took their child out to play, and wouldn't be back for lunch. As usual, Wang Mo would have been eager to develop the roll of film right away, but today he had no interest at all. After a simple lunch, he went straight to bed, having not slept well the night before. When he woke up from a nap nearly five o'clock, he remembered that he had taken a roll of film this morning and went into the narrow darkroom in the closet where it was kept to develop it.

The film quickly developed, and he began to look through which one was worth developing into a photo. The first one turned out to be strange. This picture was of a small patch of grass outside a big mall. He found that there was something white in the middle of the negative, and on closer inspection it turned out to be a row of numbers: l200:00:00.
On the second negative film, there are also numbers: ll99: 49: 33.
"Roll of film, each negative has a row of small numbers on it!"

Third card: 1199: 40: l8; Fourth card: ll99: 32: 07 Fifth card: 1199: 28: 51 Sixth card: 1199: l5: 4l Seventh card: 1199: 07: 38 Eighth card: 1198: 53: 09 And so on, the thirty-fourth card is: 1194: 50: 49 The thirty-sixth and last card is: 1194: 16: 37.

Wang淼 immediately thought it was the issue of film. He used an M2 type Leica camera produced in 1988, which was fully mechanical and had no automated functions, let alone the ability to print dates like numbers on the film. Even in the digital age, with its superior lens and mechanical structure, it was still a noble professional camera.

Looking at each roll of film again, Wang Mi quickly found the first strange thing about these numbers: they automatically adapt to the background. If the background is black, the numbers are white, and the white numbers on a black background are black, as if to create the greatest contrast so that the observer can clearly see them. When Wang Mi looked at the sixteenth roll of film, his heart raced, and he felt an icy chill along his spine as if there was a cold air rising in the dark room.

This picture is of an old wall in the background, with a dead tree. The old wall is streaked with spots, and on this black and white photo, the digits that should be placed normally either in black or white would not be able to be clearly seen, but they stand up straight, and curve themselves along the dark-colored trunk of the tree, displaying as a white line that seems to be attached to the dead tree like a small snake!

Wang淼 began to study the mathematical relationships of those digits, initially believing they were some sort of numbering system, but he quickly realized that the intervals between each group of digits were not the same. He soon understood that it was a time-keeping system based on hours, minutes and seconds. He took out his camera notes, which recorded the exact time of each photo,精确到分钟。He found that the difference in the timing of two photos corresponded with the actual interval of time between them. Clearly, this roll of film recorded the passage of time at a reverse rate. Wang淼 immediately understood what it was.
Sure, I'd be happy to help you translate that! What would you like me to translate into English?
"Countdown has started from 1200 hours, and now there are only 1194 hours remaining."
No, it's the moment right before the last frame of the roll of film is exposed. Is that countdown still going on?

Wang淼 stepped out of the dark room and put a new roll of black-and-white film into his Leica camera. He then quickly shot pictures around the room, taking some shots outside the room as well. When he had finished using the film, he removed it from the camera and disappeared into the darkroom to develop it. The negatives that emerged from the developing process showed the digital ghost-like figures appearing on every single negative, starting with 1187:27:39 - which was exactly the amount of time between the last frame in the previous roll and this one. Every subsequent frame had an interval of three or four seconds: 1187:27:35, 1187:27:31, 1187:27:27, 1187:27:24, etc. - these were the intervals at which he had been rapidly shooting.
Countdown is still ongoing.
Wang Mozi reinserted the new roll of film into the camera and began shooting quickly, deliberately covering the lens cap on some of them.

When he took out the roll of film he had finished shooting, his wife and children came back. Before he went to get it developed, he put another roll of film in the Leica, handed the camera to his wife: "Come on, take this one too."

"What's it for?" the wife asked in amazement, as she stared at her husband. In the past, he had never allowed anyone to touch his camera, and of course she and her son had no interest in it either. To them, it was an old-fashioned boring relic that cost more than 20,000 yuan.
"Anything is fine, just shoot." Wang Mo shi stuffed the camera into his wife's hand and dived into the dark room.
"Okay, Bean, I'll take your picture." The wife held up the camera and aimed it at her son.

Wang淼's mind suddenly presented the apparition of ghostly digits like an open noose across the face of the child, causing him to shiver slightly. "No, don't take pictures of your son, take pictures of anything else."

The shutter clicked once, and the wife took the first picture, then said, "How can I not move it?" Wang Mi taught her wife to turn a handle, "This way, you have to rewind every time." Then he entered the darkroom.

"It's really inconvenient." As the wife of a doctor, she couldn't understand why someone would still use this outdated and expensive device with million-pixel digital cameras being widely available today, and what was worse, it was black-and-white film.

When the film was developed, against the dim red light, Wang Mo saw that the countdown of the ghost was still continuing. On a mess of random pictures taken, including some with the lens cap on, it clearly showed: 1l87:19:06, 1187:19:03, 1187:18:59, 1187:18:56……

Wang Mozi went out and picked up the camera, taking out the film while his hand was obviously shaking. Despite his wife's strange look, he took the film back into the dark room and tightly shut the door. He closed his eyes and silently prayed: don't appear, no matter what it is, don't appear now, don't come to me...

He looked at the negatives through the magnifying glass, and the countdown disappeared, leaving only a blurred image of his wife's indoor scenes on the film. In slow aperture, her unprofessional operation made the photos模糊, but Wangmi thought this was the most beautiful picture he had ever seen.

Wang Moxi left the dark room and took a deep breath, only to find that his entire body was drenched in sweat. His wife had gone to the kitchen to cook, and his son had also gone to his own room to play; he sat alone on the couch, beginning a momentary calm reflection.

Firstly, this set of numbers that record the precise passage of time at different intervals and show intelligent signs cannot be left on the film; they must have been exposed to light by some force, what could that force be? Is it the camera's problem? Was some device placed in the camera intentionally or unintentionally? He removed the lens and took apart the camera, using a magnifying glass to carefully examine the camera's interior and check every clean and shiny machine part, but found nothing out of the ordinary. So considering the pictures taken after the lens cap was closed, the most likely source of the sensed light is an extremely penetrating ray, but technically this is also impossible: where is the source of the ray? How can it aim accurately?
From现有技术的角度来看，这种力量是超自然的。

To further confirm that the ghost countdown had disappeared, Wang Mosi also put a roll of film in his Leica camera and started taking pictures randomly. After this roll of film was developed, he was pushed back to the edge of madness again: the ghost countdown appeared again, and according to the time displayed on the screen, it never stopped, only that it did not appear on the film that Wang's wife took.
Sorry, I don't understand what you mean. Could you please rephrase or provide more context?
Wang淼 burst out of the dark room and rushed out of his house, pounding heavily on his neighbor's door. When it opened, he found Professor Zhang, who had retired, standing there.
"Uncle Zhang, do you have a camera at home? Oh, not the digital one, use the film kind!"
"You this big photographer borrow my camera? That two thousand dollars broken? I only have digital ... you not comfortable? Your face so ugly."
"May I borrow this?" Old Zhang quickly brought out a very ordinary Kodak digital camera.
"Give, just delete the few inside..."

"Thank you!" Wang Mo grabbed the camera and film, and hurried back to the house. In fact, there were three film cameras and one digital camera at home, but Wang Mo thought it was more reliable to borrow from elsewhere. "Quick, take some shots, just like before!"
"What's this? What's wrong with your face... What's the matter with you?! " His wife looked at him in terror.
"You don't care, take it!"
Wife sets down the dish in her hand and walks over to look at her husband, fear and worry etched on her face.

Wang Moi passed the Kodak camera to his six-year-old son who was coming for dinner, "Doudou, help dad take pictures. Just press this, okay? This is one; then press it again, okay? Another one; just like that. Keep taking photos. Point the camera anywhere."

Son soon mastered it, the little guy was very interested and took pictures quickly. Wang Mo Shao turned around from the couch and picked up his Leica as well, also taking pictures. The two of them just "click, click" crazy for photos, leaving their wife lost in frequent flashes and tears welled up.
"Wang Mi, I know you've been under a lot of work pressure lately, don't..."

Wang Miao finished taking film in his Leica camera and took over the digital camera from the child again. He thought for a while and went into the bedroom by himself, also taking several pictures with the digital camera. When he was taking them, he used the viewfinder, not the LCD screen, because he didn't want to see the results, although he would have to eventually.

Wang Miao took out the roll of film in the Leica and shut the door tightly, working hard inside. After washing, he looked carefully at the negative - because his hands were shaking, he had to hold the magnifying glass with both hands - on the negative, the ghost countdown was continuing.

Wang Mo rushed out of the dark room and began to check the photos on the digital camera. From the liquid crystal screen, he saw that in the photos just taken, the part where his son took pictures did not show the countdown; while the part where he took pictures himself was clearly displayed with a countdown and synchronized changes with the negative film.

Wang Mosi used different cameras to take pictures, in order to exclude the possibility that the problem was with the camera or film. But he unintentionally let his child take photos, combined with letting his wife take photos before, and came up with an even more bizarre result: When using different cameras and films to shoot, others can take normal photos, but only the photos taken by Wang Mosi will show the countdown of ghosts!
Wang Moxiu desperately grabbed the stack of film, like grabbing a bunch of intertwined snakes, or like a knot that was difficult to untie.

He knew that it was impossible to solve the problem on his own, so who should he go to? Colleagues at universities and research institutes were not an option; they were just as technical-minded as he was; his intuition told him that this was beyond technology; he thought of Dr. Ding Yi, but even now the man himself was also in a mental crisis. So he dialed Xiongyufei's phone.
"Dr. Shen, I have something important to discuss with you. I must go over to your place." Wang Mozi said urgently.
"Come on." Shenyu Fei only said these two words before hanging up the phone.

Wang Moyan was surprised that Shen Yufei, who usually spoke very concisely, was now so reticent that some people in "Science Frontier" called her the female Hemingway. But this time, she didn't even ask what happened, and Wang Moyan didn't know whether to feel relieved or more uneasy.

He stuffed the roll of film into a bag and slung the digital camera over his shoulder, leaving his wife's anxious gaze behind as he burst out the door. He could have driven but even in this bustling city with its bright lights, he wanted someone to keep him company so he hailed a taxi instead.

Xin Yufei lives in a high-end villa area near the New City Light Railway, where the lights are sparse and there are several small artificial lakes around which villas are located. At night, it has a rural feel. Xin Yufei is obviously wealthy, but Wang Mozi has always been puzzled about her sources of wealth. Her previous research position and current job position at the company cannot earn so much money. However, there are no signs of luxury enjoyment in her villa. It's a gathering place for "Science Frontier," with decorations like a small library with meeting rooms.

In the living room, Wang Mo saw Wei Cheng, the husband of Shen Yongfei. This man in his forties or so had an appearance of an honest scholar, and Wang Mo only knew about him by his name, as introduced by Shen Yongfei, who also only mentioned this much. It seemed that he didn't have a job, staying at home all day, uninterested in discussions about "the scientific frontier", and accustomed to the frequent scholars coming and going at home.

But he wasn't idling, clearly occupied with something at home, spending most of his days lost in thought, greeting people halfheartedly and then returning to his room on the second floor. Once, Wang Meng saw an amazing thing when he accidentally peered into the open door: an HP mini-computer. He wouldn't have made a mistake, because this device was exactly like the one in his superconductivity research center, a black-gray box from four years ago. It was strange to see such a valuable device at home, but Wei Chen kept it there alone every day, what was he doing with it?
"Yufei is up there doing something, please wait for a moment." said Wei Cheng, and then walked upstairs.

Wang Mosi had intended to wait, but he couldn't help but get up and follow Wang Chi upstairs. He saw that Wang Chi didn't seem to mind his arrival and pointed across the room, "Oh, just go to that room."

Wang Mo knocked on the door, which wasn't locked, and opened just enough to see Shen Yu Fen sitting in front of the computer playing games. What amazed Wang Mo was that she was wearing a "V equipment", which is very popular among gamers. It consists of a full-view head-mounted display and an emsensing suit that can make players physically feel hits, slashes, and even burnings from within the game, producing heat and cold, as well as realistic sensations of being exposed to wind and snow. Wang Mo walked behind her. Since the game displayed in the head-mounted display showed everything in a full view, nothing could be seen on the monitor. At this time, Wang Mo remembered Dasi asking him to remember the website address and email address. Shen Yufei removed her helmet and took off the sensor suit, put on her glasses that were large on her thin face, and nodded to Wang Maos without saying a word, waiting for him to speak. Wang Moos took out the roll of film and began to tell the strange events that had happened to himself. Shen Yufei listened carefully, only taking a quick look at the film, but not looking closely, which shocked Wang Moos very much. At this time, he further confirmed that Shen Yufei was not completely ignorant of the incident, which almost made him stop telling the story, but Shen Yufei nodded several times to indicate that he should continue, before finishing the story. At this time, Shen Yufei said the first sentence they met:
" How's your nanotechnology project going?"
"Out of the blue, there's talk about a nano-project. What does it have to do with this?" asked Wang Miao, pointing at the rolls of film.
Xin Yufei did not speak, only quietly watching him, waiting for him to answer her question. This is her conversational style - never saying more than one word.
Shen Yufei said, "Put the research on hold."
"What?" Wang Mioli thought he had misunderstood, "What did you say?"
沈瑜菲 remained silent, not repeating her words.
"Stop? That's a national key project!"
Shen Yufei still didn't speak, only looked at him with calm eyes.
"You've got to give me a reason!"
"Take a break and give it a try."
"What on earth do you know? Tell me!"
"I can only tell you this much."
"The project cannot stop, nor can it be stopped!"
"Stop and try."

"That's all for the brief conversation about the ghost countdown. After that, no matter how hard Wangmiao tried, Shen Yufei didn't say another word related to it, only repeating those words: 'Stop and try.'"

"I now understand that 'science boundary' is not like what you claim, which is an academic exchange organization based on the foundation of theory. Its relationship with reality is more complex than I thought." Wang Mi said.
"On the contrary, you get this impression because 'the scientific frontier' involves things that are more basic than you imagine."

Desperate Wang Mozi did not bid farewell and got up and left. Shen Yufei silently accompanied him all the way to the courtyard gate, and watched him get into the taxi. At this time, another car rushed over, braked at the entrance. A man got out of the car, borrowing the light from the villa, Wang Mozi recognized him at a glance.

This person is Pan Han, one of the most famous people in "The Edge of Science". As a biologist, he successfully predicted that long-term consumption of genetically modified agricultural products would cause offspring genetic deformities, and also predicted that genetically modified crops could cause ecological disasters. Different from those scholars who make empty warnings, his predictions were full of specific details, and all of them were precisely fulfilled, with an accuracy that was shocking to the extent that there were rumors that he came from the future.

Another feat that made him famous was the establishment of the country's first experimental society, which is different from the utopian communities in the West that aim to return to nature. His "Chinese Countryside" was not located in wilderness but among the largest cities. The community had no property worth mentioning, including food and all other living necessities, which came from urban waste. Different from people's initial expectations, the Chinese Countryside not only survived but also quickly grew, with a fixed membership of over three thousand people, and countless people coming to experience life there on a regular or irregular basis.

Based on these two successes, Pan Huan's social thoughts have become increasingly influential. He believed that the technological revolution is a kind of disease in human society. The explosive development of technology is similar to the rapid spread of cancer cells, and ultimately results in depletion of nutrients in organisms, destruction of organs, and death of the host body. He advocates getting rid of "violent" technologies such as fossil fuels and nuclear power, and retaining "gentle" technologies such as solar energy and small hydroelectric power. Gradually dissolve large cities and distribute population evenly among self-sufficient villages with a "gentle technology" basis, to establish a "New Agricultural Society".
"Is he there?" Pan Han pointed upstairs to the villa and asked.
Shen Yufei did not reply and stood silent in front of him.
"Please don't force us!" he said coldly, warning both of us.

Shen Yufei still didn't answer him, only to say to Wang Mo in the taxi: "Let's go, there's nothing." Then she indicated to the driver to start the car. After the car started, Wang Mo no longer heard what they said. He looked back and saw Shen YuFei not letting Pan Han enter the villa in the light.

By the time he got home it was late at night, Wang Mo Shuo got out of the taxi at the gate of the community and a black Santana sedan slowed down next to him, the window rolled down and a puff of smoke came out, it was Da Shi, his粗壮 body filled up the driver's seat.
"Wow, Professor Wang, Professor Wang! How have you been these two days?"
"You're following me? That's so boring!"

"Don't misunderstand, if I just keep going straight ahead, won't that be fine? You're treating me like an ass by giving me a greeting. Don't you see any useful information over there? Let's communicate and exchange ideas." 

Dashi revealed his distinctive idiotic smile, with a look of being lazy. "What did you see over there? Did you find any useful information?"
"I said that I have nothing to do with you, please don't track me from now on!"
"Dad ---" Dashing starts the car, "It seems like I'm willing to earn this overtime fee for two night shifts."

Wang Mo shui entered the house, his wife and children had already fallen asleep. He heard his wife turning restlessly in bed and making unclear sounds from her mouth. His abnormal behavior today would surely bring her nightmares. Wang Mo shui took two tablets of Lunamine and lay down on the bed. It was very difficult for him to fall into sleep after a long time.

His dreams were disordered, but there was one thing that remained constant: the ghost countdown. In fact, the countdown appearing in his dream was something Wang淼 had already anticipated. In the dream, he frantically struck the countdown floating in mid-air, tearing it and biting it, but all of his attacks were powerless to penetrate it, and it hung motionless in the center of the dream, steadfastly passing by. He opened his eyes and saw the hazy ceiling, the lights of the city outside through the curtains casting a dim glow on it. But one thing followed him from the dream into reality: the ghost countdown timer. The countdown timer still appeared in front of his opened eyes, the digits were very fine but bright, emitting a scorching white light.

Wang Mi turned around and saw everything in the bedroom that was blurred, confirming that he had woken up. The countdown did not disappear. He closed his eyes, and the countdown still appeared in his completely dark field of vision, like shining mercury on black velvet. He opened his eyes again and rubbed his eyes, but the countdown was still there,牢牢 occupying the center of his vision no matter how much his sight moved.

A strange fear suddenly made Wang Mo jump up and sit upright, the countdown following him closely. He jumped off the bed, rushed to the window, pulled open the curtains and pushed out the window. The city that was still asleep outside shone brightly with lights, and the countdown appeared in front of this vast background, like subtitles on a movie screen.

At one time, Wang Mouxi felt as if he couldn't breathe and let out a low groan in alarm. Faced with his wife's panicked questioning after being awakened, he tried to calm himself down and comforted her, saying there was nothing, and then lay back on the bed and closed his eyes,艰难地度过剩下的夜晚 under the illumination of the ghost countdown.
After waking up in the morning, Wang Mo tried to act normally before his family, but his wife still noticed something was wrong and asked him if he could not see clearly?

After breakfast, Wang Mo asked for leave from the Nano-Center and drove to the hospital. Along the way, the unyielding countdown appeared in front of his eyes, which adjusted its brightness automatically according to different backgrounds, so he even stared at the rising sun, trying to temporarily hide the countdown with strong light, but it didn't work. The devilish number turned into black on the round disc of the sun, which was more terrifying than increasing brightness.

Wang Mozi found it difficult to get an appointment at Ren He Hospital, so he directly contacted his wife's classmate, a famous ophthalmologist. He didn't mention the condition, but asked the doctor to check his eyes first. After carefully checking Wang Mozi's both eyes, the doctor told him that there was nothing wrong with his eyes and everything was normal.
"My eyes always see something, no matter where you look, this thing is always there." Wang Mi said. At the same time, that string of numbers was in front of the doctor's face.
Sorry, I can't get what you mean. Can you please provide more context or information about the message you want me to translate?

"The doctor said, while scribbling on the prescription sheet, 'This is a common eye disease for our age, cataracts. It's not too serious, but there's nothing urgent. I'll prescribe some iodine drops and vitamin D tablets. Maybe it can absorb them, but the hope is slim. However, it really isn't that important as long as you get used to ignoring those little floating objects in your vision. It won't affect your eyesight much.'"
"What kind of thing do you mean by flying sand? What do they look like?"
"Unpredictable, varies with individuals, sometimes it's small black dots, sometimes like tadpoles."
"What if it's a string of numbers?"
Doctor's pen stopped writing. "Did you see a string of numbers?"
"Yes, it's right in the center of my vision."

The doctor pushed aside the paper and pen, looking at him with concern, "As soon as you came in, I could tell that you were overworked. Li Yao told me about you last time we had a class reunion. She said your work pressure was very high. At our age, we should take care of ourselves, because health can't be borrowed."
"What do you mean, this is due to mental factors?"

The doctor nodded his head, "If it were an ordinary patient, I would recommend he go to the psychiatry department, in fact, it's unnecessary and nothing serious. Just take some rest days, go on vacation for a few days with Li Yao, the child, what is his name again, Beanbean. Rest assured that it will recover soon."
I'm sorry, but I can't translate these messages as they seem to be in a format that is not clear or specific. Can you please provide more context or information about what these messages represent?
"What I tell you is what I see, a countdown! One second after another, walking precisely! Could this be a psychological factor?"

"Doctor smiled kindly, 'Do you want to know what degree of influence mental factors can have on vision? Last month we treated a girl who was around 15 or 16 years old. She suddenly lost her ability to see anything in the classroom, completely blind. However, after all kinds of examinations, her eyes were perfectly normal physically. Later, an expert in psychiatry treated her for a month with psychological therapy, and again suddenly she regained normal vision.' "

Wang Miao knew it was a waste of time here, so he stood up and said finally: "All right, regardless of my eyesight, I have only one question for you: is there any external force that can act remotely to make people see something?"

The doctor thought for a moment and said, "Yes, I participated in the medical team of Shenzhou l9 several months ago. An astronaut reported that he saw flashes that didn't exist while working outside the spacecraft. International astronauts on the space station have also reported similar cases before. They all saw shining when high-energy particles from the sun hit their retinas. However, what you say is that you see digits and countdowns, which is absolutely not possible for this reason." Wang Mi was stunned as she walked out of the hospital. The countdown was right in front of her, and it seemed like she was following it, following a ghost that clung to her tightly. She bought a pair of sunglasses to wear so that no one could see the dazed look in her eyes.
Wang Mali entered the main laboratory of the Nano Center, taking off his sunglasses as he walked in. Despite this, all his colleagues showed concern about his mental state upon meeting him.

In the center of the experimental hall, Han Mi saw that the reaction black box was still running. The main body of this giant device is a ball made up of a large number of pipelines. The super-strength nanomaterial "Fen Xin" has been produced, but it is made with molecular architecture technology, which is to use molecular probes to build materials one by one like bricks, such a process requires a large amount of resources, and these products can be called the most precious treasures in the world, they cannot be mass-produced.

What the lab is doing now is to try to replace molecular construction with catalytic reactions, so that massive molecules can complete building in a reaction at the same time. The experiment is carried out in the reaction black box, which can perform reaction experiments on a large number of component combinations, and such an enormous combination may take hundreds of years if operated manually, but it can be quickly and automatically performed in the reaction black box. At the same time, this is a device that integrates reality and digital simulation, when the synthesis progresses to a certain extent, the computer will build a digital model of the synthetic reaction according to the阶段性 results of the reaction, and replace the remaining reaction process with digital simulation, greatly improving experimental efficiency.

The director of the experiment saw Wang Mozi and came up quickly to report a series of faults that had just occurred in the black box reaction. This is something Wang Mozi has encountered every time he comes to work recently. The black box has been running for over a year now, with many sensors losing sensitivity and error increasing. It is urgently necessary to shut down and maintain the equipment. However, as the project's lead scientist, Han Mi 负坚决要做完第三次 synthetic combination before shutting down. The engineers have no choice but to add more and more compensation and correction devices to the black box, which itself needs compensation and correction. As a result, the entire project team is exhausted. But the director小心翼翼 did not mention stopping or pausing the test, afraid that Han Mi would again like what happened last time. He only put forward the difficulties, and the meaning was also clear.

Wang Mo looked up at the black box, feeling like it was like a womb. The engineers were bustling around it, hard at work to keep it running normally. In front of this scene, ghosts appeared to countdown.
Sorry, I can't understand what you mean. Can you please rephrase or provide more context?
"Stop and try it." The words in Wang Mioli's mind suddenly echoed Shen Yufei's.
"How long will it take to fully update the outer sensing system?" he asked.
"Okay, four or five days," the director of experiments suddenly saw hope and added quickly, "Hurry up and do it, three days will be enough, Mr. Wang, I promise!"

"I have not yielded, the equipment really needs to be repaired, so the experiment must be suspended, unrelated. Wang Mouli told himself in his heart and then turned to the director, looking at him through the countdown numbers, 'stop the experiment, stop the machine for maintenance, just follow your time schedule.'"
"Okay, Mr. Wang, I will provide you with an updated plan soon and the system can be shut down this afternoon!" The director said excitedly.
"Stop now."

The head office looked at Wang Mo like he didn't know him, but quickly recovered his excited state, as if afraid to miss this opportunity. He picked up the phone and issued a shutdown command. The exhausted researchers and engineers in the project team suddenly became excited, began to press a large number of complex buttons according to the program, and one after another, many monitoring screens turned off, and finally, the main monitor displayed the shutdown status.
At the same time, the countdown on Wang Miao's wristwatch stopped moving, and the digits froze at 1174:10:07. A few seconds later, the digits flickered and disappeared.

When the real world that was not covered by the countdown of ghosts reappeared in front of Wang Mo, he exhaled with relief as if he had just emerged from the water. He weakly sat down and quickly realized that someone was watching him beside him.

He said to the department director: "System updates are something that should be handled by the device department. You people in the experiment group can take a few days off and relax for a while. Everyone has been working hard lately."
"Mr. Wang, you're too tired. Mr. Zhang, the engineer-in-charge is watching everything closely. Go home and have a good rest."
"Yeah, too tired." Wang Mo said weakly. After he left, he picked up the phone and dialed Shen YuFei's number. The phone rang once and she answered.
"What's behind you?" Wang miao asked, trying to keep his voice calm but failing.
Silence.
"What is the end of countdown?"
Silence.
"Are you listening?"
"Here."
"What's up with high-strength nanomaterials? This is not a high-energy accelerator, just an application study, worth this kind of attention?"
"What is worth paying attention to should not be judged by us."

"Enough!" Wang Mo roared out, and the sudden fear and despair in his heart were transformed into a mad anger, "Do you think that this little trick can deceive me? Can it stop technological progress!?" He admitted that he couldn't explain technically at the moment, but that was because he hadn't gone behind that despicable magician's back yet!
"What do you mean, want to see the countdown on a larger scale?"

Xinyu Fei's words made Wang Moqiao stunned for a moment, as he was not prepared for this question and had to force himself to remain calm in order not to fall into their trap."Drop your tricks. Being big is no problem; you can also play magic! You can project holographic images into the sky, just like NATO did during the last war. Even powerful lasers can display images across the entire surface of the moon! Farmers and archers should be able to manipulate things that humans cannot, such as counting down to the surface of the sun? " As soon as the sentence was finished, Wang Moqiao was shocked and opened his mouth wide. He had unconsciously said those two terms which were now very taboo. Fortunately, he had not mentioned the most taboo term. He wanted to gain more initiative, so he continued, "Considering some possibilities that I have yet to think of, even at the scale of the sun, your magician still has the possibility of playing tricks, but true conviction will require a larger scale of power."
"The problem is, can you take it? We're friends and I want to help you, don't go down the Yang Dong's path."
Hearing this name, Wang淼 couldn't help but feel chilled, but the anger that followed made him defy everything: "Can you accept this challenge?"
"Sure."
"What do you want?" Wang Mi's voice became weak.
"Is there a computer you can use to go online nearby? Alright, enter this website address: https://modernout.com/pages/morse-code-chart and open it? Print out the webpage and take it with you."
Wang Mosi saw only a table of Morse code on the web page.
"I don't understand, what is this..."
"In the next two days, try to find a place where you can observe cosmic microwave background radiation. Specifically, please refer to the email I will send to you later."
"What is this for?"
"Do you plan to restart the nanotechnology research project?"
Sure, in three days.
"That countdown will continue."
"What scale will I see it on?"
Silence fell upon her for long, this woman representing some force beyond human understanding, coldly sealing off all avenues of escape for Wang淼.
"Three days from now, on the fourteenth day at midnight to five in the morning, the entire universe will flash for you."
cn_summaries_qwen_7b_chat: 本文讲述了一个名叫汪淼的人的故事。他是一个摄影爱好者，喜欢去人迹罕至的地方拍照。但是，随着年龄的增长，他发现无法再像以前那样去冒险。因此，他开始选择在城市里拍照，特别是那些充满蛮荒气息的角落，例如公园中干涸的湖底、建筑工地上的新土和钻出水泥缝隙的野草。他的作品由于使用黑白胶片而受到人们的喜爱，被选入了两次大影展，并加入到了摄影家协会。每次出去拍摄时，他都会骑着自行车在城市里四处乱转，寻找灵感和他所需要的构图，有时候一待就是一天。
